info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 11:01PM MDT until May 21 at 11:15PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM PDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BOUNDARY COUNTY... At 1000 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of Moyie Springs, or 11 miles southeast of Bonners Ferry, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Boundary County. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 73 and 80. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
